essence: Interplay of light and darkness through combustion in an enclosed space

primary_constituents.name: Candle
primary_constituents.description: Solid fuel composed of wax and a wick, capable of undergoing exothermic oxidation when ignited

primary_constituents.name: Room
primary_constituents.description: Enclosed space with no ambient electromagnetic radiation in the visible spectrum

primary_constituents.name: Flame
primary_constituents.description: Localized region of sustained exothermic oxidation producing visible electromagnetic radiation

primary_constituents.name: Air
primary_constituents.description: Mixture of gases including diatomic oxygen (O₂) and nitrogen (N₂), with trace noble gases

governing_framework: Conservation of energy through thermal and radiant energy conversion
Chemical reaction between hydrocarbon molecules and diatomic oxygen
Propagation of visible light through scattering in a dark medium
driving_forces_and_potential: Thermal gradient driving heat transfer from combustion to surroundings
Radiant energy diffusion through the room's volume
Gradual consumption of fuel mass through oxidative decomposition
foundational_state: Dark room with lit candle, atmospheric pressure at 101.325 kPa, temperature at 298 K
